Class Processor

java.lang.Object
SystemEnvironment.Processor
public class Processor extends Object
Central coordinator for the real-time simulator that owns cores, core sets, the global scheduler, concurrency controller, DVFS regulator and the task and resource sets.

Processor orchestrates the end-to-end simulation flow across different scheduling modes (SingleCore, Partition, Global, Hybrid). It:

  • manages all cores and core groups (CoreSet) and their IDs;
  • accepts a PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm and wires it to per-core or global schedulers as appropriate;
  • holds a ConcurrencyController to react to job arrivals, preemptions, deadlines and locks;
  • holds a DynamicVoltageRegulator and forwards DVFS events (arrivals, first execute, periodic checks, completion, deadline miss);
  • owns the global ready queue for Global/Hybrid scheduling;
  • tracks simulation time and provides helper execution loops (globalExecute(long) and execute(long)).

Inline comments (including Chinese notes) were integrated where relevant: grouping of cores into sets, priority recalculation for dynamic priority, migration and waiting behavior, and the per-tick execution steps (choose, check costs, ready, DVFS checks, run, block accounting, completion, cost cleanup, and end-of-time actions).

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • Processor

      public Processor()
      Constructs a processor with empty core/core-set collections, initialized global scheduler, concurrency controller, DVFS regulator and partition distributor all wired back to this processor. The global ready queue is empty and system time starts at 0.

  • Method Details

    • addCore

      public void addCore(Core c)
      Adds a core to this processor and assigns it a 1-based ID.
      Parameters:
      c - the core to add

    • addCoreSet

      public void addCoreSet(CoreSet coreSet)
      Adds a core set (group) to this processor and assigns it a 1-based group ID.
      Parameters:
      coreSet - the core set to add

    • loadTaskSet

      public void loadTaskSet(TaskSet ts)
      Loads the task set handled by this processor (replaces any previous set).
      Parameters:
      ts - the task set to use

    • loadResourceSet

      public void loadResourceSet(SharedResourceSet rs)
      Loads the shared resource set used by tasks (replaces any previous set).
      Parameters:
      rs - the shared resource set

    • partitionTasks

      public void partitionTasks()
      Partitions tasks to cores when using SingleCore or Partition scheduling.

      Invokes the configured PartitionDistributor and then logs the mapping Task(ID) â†’ Core(ID). This method is a no-op under Global/Hybrid scheduling types.

    • globalExecute

      public void globalExecute(long t)
      Executes a global-style scheduling step for a time slice, pushing jobs from the global ready queue to eligible cores, preparing them to run and advancing their execution.

      High-level sequence (integrated from inline comments):

      1. Check for job arrivals and update global priorities if dynamic.
      2. While possible, dispatch from global queue to the core whose head job is lowest priority or idle.
      3. Ask each core to choose the next job, then ready cores to run.
      4. Update core-set speeds and run each core for the given slice.
      5. Increment system time, then check completions and deadlines.
      Some controller/DVFS/cost checks are commented in the source and can be toggled as needed.
      Parameters:
      t - the time slice to run (simulation ticks)

    • execute

      public void execute(long t)
      Schedules CPU execution for one time unit (or the provided slice) across all cores with full controller/DVFS/cost handling.

      Sequence (from inline notes by the original author): choose jobs, check cost queues, ready cores, check costs again, perform DVFS checks, set core-set speeds, run for t, update system time, account blocking in local queues, mark completions, check deadline misses, perform final cost cleanup, and notify DVFS of end-of-time.

      Parameters:
      t - the time slice to run (simulation ticks)

    • schedulerCalculatePriorityForFixed

      public void schedulerCalculatePriorityForFixed()
      Calculates fixed priorities for tasks according to the configured scheduling type and installed algorithms.

      For SingleCore and Partition, delegates to each core's local scheduler; for Global, uses the processor-level scheduler. Hybrid is currently marked as TODO in the source.

    • JobArrives

      public void JobArrives(Job j)
      Adds an externally arriving job into the global ready queue.
      Parameters:
      j - the arriving job

    • showInfo

      public void showInfo()
      Prints processor information: CoreSet grouping, per-core IDs, and power model parameters (alpha, beta, gamma) along with available speeds and corresponding power consumption per CoreSet.

    • setModelName

      public void setModelName(String s)
      Sets the processor model name (as read from processor.xml).
      Parameters:
      s - the model name

    • setParentSimulator

      public void setParentSimulator(Simulator s)
      Sets the parent simulator reference used for reporting (e.g., deadline misses) and global configuration.
      Parameters:
      s - the parent simulator

    • setSchedAlgorithm

      public void setSchedAlgorithm(PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm a)
      Installs the priority-driven scheduling algorithm and wires it to either the global scheduler or per-core schedulers depending on the selected scheduling type. Logs the configured schedulers.
      Parameters:
      a - the scheduling algorithm to use

    • setCCProtocol

      public void setCCProtocol(ConcurrencyControlProtocol p)
      Installs the concurrency-control protocol used by the controller and logs its name.
      Parameters:
      p - the concurrency control protocol

    • setDVFSMethod

      public void setDVFSMethod(DynamicVoltageAndFrequencyScalingMethod m)
      Installs the DVFS method on the regulator and logs its name.
      Parameters:
      m - the dynamic voltage and frequency scaling method to use

    • setPartitionAlgorithm

      public void setPartitionAlgorithm(PartitionAlgorithm a)
      Installs the partition algorithm used to distribute tasks to cores.
      Parameters:
      a - the partition algorithm implementation

    • getLowerPriorityCore

      public Core getLowerPriorityCore()
      Selects the core with the lowest-priority head job that can be preempted, or an idle core if one exists. Used to decide where to place the next job from the global ready queue in global scheduling.
      Returns:
      a target core for dispatch, or null if none is suitable
